params.signature: The provided signature of the input struct
params.signer: The signer's address that we want to verify

returns._0: Returns true if the signature corresponds to the signer  having signed the input struct

params.signature: The provided signature of the input struct
params.signer: The signer's address that we want to verify

returns._0: Returns true if the signature corresponds to the  provided signer having signed the input struct

verifySellerSignature(bytes,(bytes32,uin.details: To anticipate for future potential differences in verifiers for  BuyNow/Auction listings, the interfaces to verifiers for both flows are   kept separate, accepting the entire respective structs as input.  For the same reason, the interface declares the method as 'view', prepared  to use EIP712 flows, even if the initial implementation can be 'pure'.

params.sellerSignature: the signature of the seller agreeing to list the asset as ruled by  this explicit paymentId

returns._0: Returns true if the seller signature is correct

verifyAssetTransferResult((bytes32,bool).notice: Verifies that the provided AssetTransferResult struct  has been signed by the provided signer.

verifyBuyNow((bytes32,uint256,uint256,ui.notice: Verifies that the provided BuyNowInput struct has been signed  by the provided signer.

verifySellerSignature(bytes,(bytes32,uin.notice: Verifies the seller signature showing agreement   to list the asset as ruled by this explicit paymentId.
